intro: Adenocalymma punctifolium, commonly known as the punctate leaf adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves with distinctive punctate markings. It produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Adenocalymma punctifolium is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
